title: AI Agents Replace 40% of Knowledge Work by 2028
description: Autonomous AI agents handling research, scheduling, email, and basic analysis will displace significant portions of white-collar work faster than expected. The infrastructure is already here â€” it's just a matter of adoption curves.
author: matt@fortune0.com

title: Local-First Apps Become Default by 2027
description: Privacy concerns and AI capabilities push computing back to the edge. SQLite + local LLMs + encrypted sync becomes the standard architecture. The cloud becomes optional, not required.
author: anon

title: Open Source Eats Incubators
description: YC's playbook gets open-sourced. Community-run accelerators with transparent equity terms outcompete traditional VCs for early-stage deals. The 7% standard falls to 2-3%.
author: founder@startup.io

title: Per-Seat SaaS Pricing Dies by 2027
description: AI agents don't have seats. Usage-based pricing becomes the only model that makes sense when one person with AI can do the work of ten. Salesforce, Slack, and others will be forced to adapt.
author: pricing-nerd
